Module com.example.rubankgui
Package com.example.rubankgui

Class AccountDatabase

java.lang.Object
com.example.rubankgui.AccountDatabase
public class AccountDatabase extends Object
Defines a linear data structure using an array to hold a list of accounts with different types.
Author:
Deshna Doshi, Haejin Song

  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - Account that is being searched for
      Returns:
      index of account if found, else NOT_FOUND

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Increases the size of the accounts array by 4.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Account account)
      Check if an account already exists in the list.
      Parameters:
      account - Account to be compared
      Returns:
      true if account is already in the database, false otherwise

    • open

      public boolean open(Account account)
      Add an account to the array, if it doesn't already exist
      Parameters:
      account - Account to be opened
      Returns:
      true if the account is added, false if it is not added.

    • close

      public boolean close(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - Account that is being removed from the database
      Returns:
      true if successfully closed, false otherwise

    • withdraw

      public boolean withdraw(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - Account that is being withdrawn from
      Returns:
      true if successfully withdrawn from, false otherwise

    • deposit

      public void deposit(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - Account that money is being deposited in

    • advancedFind

      private int advancedFind(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - Account that is being searched for
      Returns:
      index of account if found, else NOT_FOUND Note: This is different from find because it makes sure that the difference between a CC and C is accounted for when looking for accounts. This is necessary for methods like deposit().

    • printSorted

      public String printSorted()
      Prints out accounts sorted by account types, then last name, then first name, then DOB.

    • printFeesAndInterests

      public String printFeesAndInterests()
      Prints out accounts sorted by account type, and displays calculated fees and monthly interest based on current account balances.

    • printUpdatedBalances

      public String printUpdatedBalances()
      Prints out accounts sorted by account type, and updates account balances by adding fees and interest. Also resets withdrawals for MM. Acts like one month has passed.

    • arrayForSorting

      public Account[] arrayForSorting(Account[] accountsArray)
      Parameters:
      accountsArray - Account that nulls are being removed from
      Returns:
      an array with no nulls

    • quickSort

      public void quickSort(Account[] unsortedArray, int low, int high)
      Implementation of Quicksort for print methods.
      Parameters:
      unsortedArray - the array that is being sorted
      low - the first index of the part of the array being sorted
      high - the last index of the part of the array being sorted

    • partition

      private int partition(Account[] unsortedArray, int low, int high)
      Parameters:
      unsortedArray - Account that is being sorted
      low - Value of lowest index
      high - Value of highest index
      Returns:
      current pivot

    • swap

      private void swap(int i, int j, Account[] A)
      Swap i and j with each other in the array

    • depositNotFound

      public boolean depositNotFound(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - Account that is being searched for
      Returns:
      true if found, otherwise false

    • findUniqueIndex

      public int findUniqueIndex(Account account)
      Parameters:
      account - Account that is being searched for
      Returns:
      index of account if found, else NOT_FOUND

      Parameters:
      mm - Account that will have withdraws updated

      public void updateLoyalty(Account mm)
